newsitem.title: FRANCE: French sugar consumption rose in April - FIRS.
newsitem.headline: French sugar consumption rose in April - FIRS.

text.p: French sugar consumption rose to a provisional 186,000 tonnes in April from a revised 158,000 tonnes in March and from 180,195 tonnes in April 1996, national sugar intervention board FIRS said on Thursday.

This would bring cumulative sales to the French market for the first seven months of the 1996/97 season (Oct/Sept) to 1.147 million tonnes against 1.096 million in the same period for 1995/96, data from FIRS issued in a June report showed.
